The very annoying guy in the room next door also had a very loud voice. At 7am, we could hear every word of his phone conversation. * The room did not have a safe. We used one for free in reception but what a pain to have to keep popping downstairs to pick things up or drop things off. As a result, we did risk security more than we would by leaving stuff in the room that we would have usually locked in a room safe. The room did have a good sized balcony, overlooking the Bay and the pool. The TV worked ok, though seemed to have limited stations. It had an iron and ironing board and a reasonable shower, though no bath. Overall, we weren't impressed with the hotel at all, other than with the staff, who were all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but I think I was allergic to the room.”
Reviews.Author: archangeli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was assigned to my friends & I by Travel Planners for an event (Comic-Con). It is not a bad hotel, but a couple of us had allergies hit us like a ton of bricks! We suspect it is either dust or a reaction to something they use to clean the rooms. Never once did I see the housekeeping staff with a vacuum so I'm betting it's dust. The hotel room was comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful whenever we needed to ask them anything. Our room was on the 6th floor and had 2 double beds, each bed had 2 firm and 2 soft pillows (with a little ribbon to identify them). There was a coffee/tea maker, TV, no fridge in the room, but a nice balcony (with a city street view). The closet is inside the bathroom - weird and a bit inconvenient. The bathroom door is a sliding door of frosted glass. Not only could you not lock it, the door left a gap on one side (awkward!) and you could see the silhouette of the person inside (even more awkward!). Bathroom amenities are Bath & Body Works Coconut & Verbena scented. The blow-dryer was one of the wall mounted gizmo's that no matter how long you use it your hair never gets dry. As someone else mentioned, if you sit on the toilet seat cover, it buckles and bows from y our weight. The bathroom lighting was a bit dim - I ended up doing my makeup sitting on the bed with natural light from the balcony window. The shower stall is spacious, but had weird drainage issues. Inevitably I'd be standing in a soapy puddle 3" deep after taking a 10 minute shower and I always felt bad for whoever had to use it next. Even after the maid cleaned the room there would still be some water in the shower. Other than the mysterious allergies likely brought on by dust, the room was clean. Not to be stereotypical or rude - but the maid only spoke and understood Spanish. Um... really? I thought that was a sitcom joke, but I guess not. There is a nice outdoor pool in the atrium of the hotel but the weather was too cool for us to use it. The elevators don't require you to swipe a key, which makes me nervous because anyone could just waltz right in off the street. Our room's door never closed very well on it's own - we either had to push it shut or pull it closed when we were leaving. The free Wi-Fi was atrociously slow! Bearable on a laptop but useless for my iPhone. The Santa Fe depot is a short walk away - great if you are catching AMTRAK or taking the trolley. To head to the convention center & Gaslamp district the America Place stop is just across the street from the Santa Fe depot. Would I stay here again? Hopefully not (hear that Travel Planners?!!). Because it was an event weekend I was stuck paying $215/night for a hotel that was only worth about $65 in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “The accomodations were excellent”
Reviews.Author: bspain
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean nice and so convenient to everything. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Just made the entire stay plesant!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: PARunner217
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for six nights at the end of July. We had a room fronting the bay and had none of the noise issues (trolley and planes taking off) that people facing the city had. The view of the bay was great. Another plus is that the hotel is also very close to a lot of attractions (Seaport Village, USS Midway, historic ships, Coronado Ferry, Gaslamp district) that we were able to walk to. I also liked being able to run along the bay in the morning. We liked the hotel's shuttle service to/from airport and the zoo, but wished they would add another drop off and pick up time for attractions in mid-afternoon. We took the 9 a.m. shuttle to the zoo. Next shuttle pick up was 11:20 which would have been too soon. The shuttle pick up after that one was 4:20. We were done before that and ended up taking a taxi back to the hotel which cost us $13. Breakfast is not provided and I think for the price, they could offer something complimentary to guests. I don't understand how similar hotels in that price range (Residence Inn by Marriott and Holiday Inn Express) offer free breakfasts but the Holiday Inn doesn't. We ate one morning at the Elephant and Castle. Breakfast for 2 was $30. Other mornings I ended up walking to Ralph's Grocery Store on G Street and bought yogurts, milk and fruit. They also had some hot breakfast sandwiches. At a $1.99 my son really enjoyed the croissant egg and cheese sandwich. It ended up being a lot cheaper than eating out every morning. The room itself was decent size. I agree with the others who said it seemed a little odd to have the closet in the bathroom. The frosted sliding glass was also a little different. Wireless internet is a nice plus but it was a very slow connection. The business center only allowed you to print boarding passes for free. Otherwise there is a charge. Although it was relatively cool when we visited, the two exercise rooms were extremely hot. Something needs to be done about the ventilation in there. My son would work out for about an hour lifting weights and come back to the room completely drenched. Staff seemed average. Not overly friendly but not rude either. Overall, we enjoyed our visit although I would probably look to stay at another hotel if we go to San Diego again just to experience something new and different.

Reviews.Title: “Elephant & Castle saved me!”
Reviews.Author: Tomochan
Reviews.Content: My friends & I stayed for 4 nights on the South tower (room 381) We paid extra for the bayside view. Folks, it's worth the extra money. Some of my friends stayed in the rooms facing towards the city and they had to get ear plugs to protect themselves from the incessant train noise. We didn't hear a thing in our room. The check-in process was painless but slow. The water pressure from the shower was decent and I liked how the sink and the toilet/tub was separated. The room itself was decent size for three people to share. The bed was comfortable and clean. The hotel is within walking distance from the seaport village and other sights. There is a free shuttle from the airport as well as Horton plaza, seaport village and the San Diego zoo. We usually came back late from a conference so having Elephant & Castle definitely saved us in terms of having a nice drink and some great pub fare.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel by the water”
Reviews.Author: imcakes
Reviews.Content: We won this on priceline for $70 a night. We got a balcony with a view of the pool...the harbor view was $40 a night extra and wasn't a big deal to us. The room was recently remodeled with a nice bathroom. There is no tub only a shower so not good if you can't bend over to shave your legs. I read someone said the door to the bathroom was wierd because it was kind of see thru, but this didn't bother us. The pool was nice and well maintained with fresh towels in the chairs everyday. Staff was friendly, especially the housekeepers. Check in was relatively fast. Parking is $22 a night but always found a spot right on the first floor. Work out room had alot of equipment, looked old but saw a lot of folks using it. Didn't try the restaurant but looked busy and Ruth Chris' next door. They have a computer to use for internet searching but that is all it will do. I tried to print an email but you have to use the other computer that cost 5.95 per 15 mins. I was told it had all the programs available on it (like Excel, etc). Overall we were happy with the Holiday Inn on the bay, mainly because of the good price so really have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great view, good services”
Reviews.Author: liawim
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surpriced by the standard of the hotel at arrival, and had a good four-night stay. Rooms were nice, the bed was large and comfy, it was quiet, and there was a free shuttle bus to the airport. The hotel is located just across the street from the cruise ship terminal, and is within walking distance from USS Midway, The Seaport Village and Gaslamp Quarter. We used the gym once, and were able to get an OK workout, but the equipment seems old, and there are not many weights. The hotel had a possibility to do laundry on your own ($1 to start the washing machine), which we greatly appreciated after a few weeks on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: andyeisenberg
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, not fancy but clean and appeared to be well-run. My room was more than adequate for a week's stay for business. I enjoyed the location, with many places to dine and see within easy walking distance. It was lovely looking out over the water. The on-site restaurant was also good when I was too tired to go out at night and they had a good selection of various beers. The front desk staff and the in-room cleaning staff were all very efficient and friendly. I can't think of anything that could have made my stay better except free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but slow service”
Reviews.Author: ichabod104
Reviews.Content: The check in took forever, the names were misspelled and we had problems checking in. if not for tyhe reservation numbers it would have been a disaster and the front desk was less then helpful in solving any problems. He didn't seem to care nor did he make any effort to help the situation with the lost rooms. We had the reservation numbers and he found them but only after we insisted. Outside was dirty, food on the roof and a condom hanging from a balcony. Great location but the front desk staff was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Gaslamp area....”
Reviews.Author: marilynn63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at best. I stayed in the South Tower and the decor is in need of a facelift. The view is amazing but pretty much all I can recommend. The price was high for an average room. Room service got my order wrong three out of three times but never offered to do anything for my inconvenience. The service at the attached gift shop was the motivator for me coming online to write a review. I had eaten at the pub in the lobby several times (stick to pub food orders....if you want a steak go to the Ruth Chris's on the property) and on my final evening I decided to walk across to the gift shop for a candy bar to take to my room for later. I was unable to get the candy bar. I had no cash on me as I had taken my credit card and my room key. I had no problem in the restaurant....I could have charged to the room or paid by credit card. I asked the gift shop clerk if I could charge the candy bar to my room to avoid going to my room to get cash. She first went in search of the guest list to verify I was a guest. When she could not find this she went to the manager's office to request it. The manager came out and said to make sure to get a picture ID before I could be allowed to charge to my room. I told them I did not have a picture ID on me so I would use my credit card which I really didn't want to do....a $1 or $2 purchase on my American Express did not make a lot of sense. But the manager said I would have to have a picture ID for the credit card also. Wow, if I was making a large purchase I could see all the ID requirements....but really, annoying a guest for the price of a candy bar?!?! I left without my candy bar and contacted guest services when I returned to my room but they could do nothing but transfer me to the gift shop as they did not manage the business. If I return to the San Diego area, I will not be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average service - noisy”
Reviews.Author: gjwjmb
Reviews.Content: I found both the front desk staff and concierge very disinterested and unfriendly. Our room faced the city and the main railway line runs just behind the hotel meaning bells constantly ringing. The wardrobe is located in the bathroom which is rather inconvenient. Also no shower cap provided. The only restaurant is the Elephant and Castle which is pretty basic. The location is quite good for restaurants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: munkeycreed
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on our week long vacation in San Diego. I read some of the reviews below before booking this hotel and was a little worried but got such a great deal felt I would take my chances and I am glad I did! This was an excellent hotel to stay at for my boyfriend and I. The rooms were very clean the beds comforable and the staff very friendly. We stayed in the South Tower, and had a city view which could be a little loud at times because it is near the train station, but hey it was San Diego you shouldnt be sleeping all day anyways! The restaurant and deli at the hotel were very good and had reasonable prices. You are right across the street from the bay where it is just a short walk to many restaurants and shops. Also across the street is a Ferry that will take you to Coronado Island (but it is really not an island) where you can walk to coronado beach or enjoy the shops and restaurants they have there. The free shuttle was on time from the airport and too as well as the zoo. You are in short walking distance about 1 mile to the Gaslamp Quarters, Baseball Stadium, Hortan Plaza and a little shorter walk to Seaport Village. If you are not a walker there are plenty of ways to get around if you dont rent a car. There are pedi cabs that will take you most places and you just tip them. My stay here was excellent and I did not want to leave. I would stay at this hotel again 100%. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel there are plenty in San Diego go to one. If you are looking for a clean and friendly hotel that is reasonably priced then this is the place to stay! I wish I could go back right now!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel...nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jahlygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a week while on a business trip. It's right on the bay...which is nice. Many tourist attractions and boat rides are at your doorstep. That being said, it's also right by the airport, and you can hear the planes taking off and landing. It was so bad, I had to purchase earplugs. The staff at the frontdesk were very nice. Inititally, they had me staying in the north tower, but when I got to the room and realized by balcony was right next to a parking garage, I asked to be moved becuase I didn't feel safe. They moved me to a room in the South Tower. It seems as though the South Tower (the tower were the front desk is located) is more updated than the north tower. The bathroom looked like it had been redone recently. It was modern and clean...but the room was just average. The gym leaves MUCH to be desired. The only equipment were a few nautilus machines and 1 bike, all of which looked like they were bought at a yard sale in the early 1980s. But, I guess most people just go running along the marina. The pool is small. There are also weird smells that come out of the elevator bank (I'm guesing the kitchen was right below). The hotel is about a 25-30 minute walk to the Gaslamp district/ Convention Center, or a $7-8 cab ride. The onsite restaurent isn't that great, but at least there's a Ruth's Chris right next door. I did like that the hotel has a free shuttle to the airport that leaves every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Average Holiday Inn - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colewade
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here while attending a national professional conference in may 2010. Arriving two days early, you might say that this was every bit as much a leisure trip as much as business. We highly recommend this hotel. The Hotel In spite of being of an older vintage, we found the hotel to be stylish and comfortable. The public and guest rooms have been recently updated. The hotel is of an earlier vintage, but in some ways this is good. Most of the rooms have a full sized balconies with plenty of room for two chairs and a table. The View The view of the bay is worth the extra charge. The view here may even be better than those further down the bay like the Marriot, Hilton, or Hyatt. Being located further north along the bay, you get a really clear view of the large open expanse that is north San Diego Bay. The bay view rooms have a clear view of the cruise ships, the Maritime Museum, the Midway Museum, the airport, Presido Park and Point Loma in the distance. Did I mention the entire north end of the embarcadero? We had considered the Best Western Bayside, but it is simply not bayside. Only the Holiday Inn on the Bay is - in this neighborhood. The Noise Many travelers have noted the noise level in this hotel. We found that the plane take-offs taper dramatically during the night hours. This noise is greatly diminished by simply closing the glass sliding door. We had two cruise ship departures which were during the day hours, and a source of excitement being a frequent cruiser. Having a Bay view room, I did not find the noise to be a real problem. Being in a lovely corner smoking room on the 10th floor, we could here the bells and clangs of approaching trains on the outside deck, but not at all with the door closed. The Service and Facilities We found the service to be very good overall. All the employees we encountered were actually very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping was excellent, and the bed was very comfortable. If you are going to take advantage of the room service, I recommend the â€œBest 4 Valueâ€� breakfast which includes a full breakfast for $9.95. More often, we used the coffee stand at the elevators in the north tower which had excellent coffee, pastries and the ability to charge to your room. Hazelwoods in the south tower will also charge any meal to your room. Breakfast and lunch are there stronger suits. The Elephant and Castle Pub in the main lobby is a lovely place with an immaculately groomed patio area and decent food. The pool was nice and warm and big enough for my taste. They have not one, but two fitness centers. The convenient on-site parking is what it is at $22 per day, but they will include it as a room charge if so desired. The Location I loved the location, but it will not be to everyoneâ€™s taste. Easy walk to Little Italy, Maritime Museum, Harbor Cruise and Coronado Ferry. Great dinner locations within walking distance at Indigo Grill, Fish Market, Burger Lounge, Buon Appetito, or Fillipiâ€™s. It about one mile north of the Convention Center, but the walk is lovely along the embarcadero. The trolleys at American Plaza will get you to the Convention Center more quickly, but still involve about a half mile walk. If you are leaving on a cruise you really canâ€™t do better than this hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good people, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: ConVivo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is from the 70's (and before) but they have done a great job with the updates and the rooms are comfortable. If you need a a desk for work, ask for a room with one on check in. This time I had a small table to work from, which is fine, but a desk is better. Ask for a room with a bay view - truly relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great precruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dblane
Reviews.Content: Nice holiday Inn right across from the cruise port. Stayed in a balcony room, upper floor, facing the bay and had great views. Within walking distance of the Midway, great afternoon tour. Restaurant is nice, good food and sevice but a bit pricey. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay the night before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: Guadalupe110
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for one night before we went on a cruise. This hotel was probably built in the 60s and the rooms are small by today's standards but everything has been tastefully redecorated and was extremely clean. The location is excellent for exploring the waterfront, downtown and the cruise terminal is right across the street. The beds were amazingly comfortable. However, if you are sensitive to sounds, bring your earplugs or stay elsewhere. The airport is nearby, and a train runs behind the hotel. However, I did not hear, nor was I bothered by any of these things. And if you are on the harbor side, the view is fantastic. Good price too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: utahtravler
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night before going on a cruise. The location was perfect. We spent the day walking and seeing the sights. The staff was very friendly, hotel was clean, and our room was very quite. We would stay here again. The only surprise we had was the parking was $28.00 per day. But, we did ask the front desk about keeping our car parked at the hotel during the cruise, and we pre-paid $9.00 per day. It was covered, and we felt safe leaving our car.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as it seems”
Reviews.Author: jockgrieve
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on tripadvisor i was a bit worried about staying here. but unless you are stuck here on buisness and have no intention of going out and enjoying yourself then it might be a little bit noisey on the train track side of the hotel. but if youre in san diego to have a little bit of fun, then youre in the right place, if youve got nothing to do during the day grab a bike from the rental place next door and youll get to see all the sights in town for $ 15, walking distance from hundreds of great bars and reaturants, hotel facilities ok, room very tidy, and bed comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Harbor view was excelent”
Reviews.Author: cindylou46
Reviews.Content: We was on the 10 floor, whatta a view, of the harbor. The only thing was a joke of a coffee pot. A one cup deal, so we went out and bought a 4 cup pot. After the planes stop flying for the night, it was quiet. Then come about 6am they start up again. Would come again, just bring my own coffee pot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jason1028
Reviews.Content: A great location with a great view of the bay. I was a little leary aboust staying at the Holiday Inn because I was use to the Marriott chain; however, my experience at the Holiday Inn was great. The staff were friendly, especially Mark at the concierge desk. The rooms were nice with a great view of the bay. the bed was comfortable, I slept like a baby. Although the airport and amtrak are within miles of the hotel, I did not hear any loud noises at night. The hotel also have a a shuttle that takes you to and from the airport, San diego Zoo and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel for San Diego Cruise Ship Terminal access”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Visitors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance of the Amtrak station and the Cruise Ship terminal. We walked from the Amtrak Station at night and then to the cruise ship terminal in the morning with all of our luggage. The location is brilliant. The front desk staff are the friendliest and warmest staff we have ever dealt with. The hotel should be congratulated for this. The hotel rooms are a bit old and tired but if you are lucky enough to get a front room with a view of the bay, then who cares about the room. Waking up to this view was wonderful. I would fully recommend that you pay for and request a room with a view of the bay. If you are going on a cruise you wont find a better location to stay before boarding your ship.

Reviews.Title: “Only for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Nekolover
Reviews.Content: This was a standard Holiday Inn, except I thought the price was very expensive for what I was getting. If I were leaving from San Diego for a cruise I would stay here, since the cruise terminal is directly across the street from the Hotel. Otherwise, I would stay elsewhere, such as near Sea World because this Hotel was, I thought, expensive

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a very noisy dump”
Reviews.Author: jwcf
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and I couldn't wait to get home and get some sleep. I was awakened by the train whistle at midnight and 5:30 AM, and by the trash removal at 6AM. The overall noise level was ridiculously loud, and if you open the balcony door would can only hear the roar of the building's equipment. The rooms are badly decorated, mismatched in style and color, and with the closet in the bathroom. There is a desk, but no table and chairs to have a meal from room service. It seems this hotel is geared to a male business traveller with no expectations of quality. There was no shower cap, and the coffee system makes onhe cup at a time. The hotel restaurants were very generic. Overall, a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: VermontStan
Reviews.Content: I just got back from San Diego and I can honestly say that my hotel experience was great. Every hotel employee I ran into was friendly and accomodating. I had a room in the south tower that looked out to the water. The room was very clean as was the bathroom and in excellent condition. Housekeeping does a very nice job and the room was cleaned early in the day.The room had a king sized bed and was comfortable. plenty of towels on hand also. One of the things I liked best about the hotel was that it was centrally located. It's right across the street from the cruise ship terminal, ship museum and harbor cruises. It was also within walking distance to restaurants and entertainment venues. The restaurant in the hotel had reasonably priced, quality food and excellent service. The concierge was friendly and very helpful answering questions. One minor drawback is that there is free computer use, but it is a single computer at the concierge desk with no privacy. The pool was decent and looked clean. The fitness center is well equipped and clean. Overall, a very reasonable price for a very nice hotel. I will go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Awesome View”
Reviews.Author: alukaiser
Reviews.Content: I manage about 35 customer service employees in a difficult industry, so when I have a great customer service experience worthy of my own company (very rare) I definitely want to give them props. The night of our stay some idiots vandalized my car in the parking garage. The security guard couldn't catch up to them and they got away. When we found the damage the manager Ignacio greeted us, gave us the full story, and stayed with us for almost an hour as I filled out the police report and incident report for the hotel. Then, without us even asking, they comped our room, room service, and parking (over $250) for our trouble! That's pretty cool. The hotel's insurance might cover the damage, but if they don't that shouldn't reflect on the staff at the Holiday Inn as that's a totally different company. Besides that, you can't beat the view from our room. Spring the extra $15 and get a view room with a balcony if you are staying for leisure, TRUST ME. It's not some 5 star elegant room, but it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Average Room”
Reviews.Author: debp
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn staff went above and beyond for my colleague from China who was confused about the correct Holiday Inn. The front desk was the most pleasant of any hotel (3-5 star) I have stayed at in years. They deserve big thank you's. A taxi stand is right outside the door. This is a convenient location by taxi for the convention center (about $9), gas lamp district, etc. You can walk to the cruise ship dock, Midway museum and the Star of India. A very nice bagel and danish coffee stand is in the lobby and the gift shop is open early -another thank you for service. The items that are just average are the room - a little dated, but clean and the food in the restaurant which was forgettable. The internet was free for my business, but only worked some of the time. The truly disappointing part is that the train that runs through downtown wakes you up all night long. It is not just a short whistle, it is several whistles over a mile. Note that you will hear this at many of the downtown hotels because the train runs right across all the surface streets. I would stay here again, but wish they would update the room decor. Note also that the dry cleaning rate was above what I have paid elsewhere, but it was delivered exactly on time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for cruise ships”
Reviews.Author: taffytoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. The location was great. Very short distance from airport and just across the street from cruise ship. We found the hotel to be very nice. There is no breakfast buffet but a great deli just 2 doors away. The shuttle was very prompt in picking us up from airport. The hostess at hotel told us we were welcome to walk back across street after cruise and take shuttle back to airport. We were very impressed by this. I had a discussion with some guests on cruise ship about this hotel and they were very negative about the hotel while I thought it was great and told them so. However, when we went back for shuttle to airport we were met by hotel manager who was less than friendly about the shuttle back to airport. Wanted to know who had told me they would shuttle us back to airport. I told him about conversation on cruise ship and that I had enjoyed our stay there but he could ruin it by his attitute. He did allow shuttle to take us to airport. The only thing I can say is they need to resolve this issue internally because other guests also had been told same thing and were back at hotel for shuttle to airport. Otherwise, very nice hotel and would recommend. Manager might need to lighten up a little. Other hotel personnel very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “we had excellent hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: BBDBArkansas
Reviews.Content: We went when it was raining a lot. However the staff of the hotel and the bus drivers went out of thier way to make our stay comfortable. the rooms were comfortable with a good view. the location was excellent. We could walk to anywhere on the harbor or downtown. The trolley system was within two blocks of the hotel and it went throughout the city. The bus system also had a stop by the hotel. the only thing we did not like was the lack of bathtubs andlittle water pressure in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience after the first night”
Reviews.Author: bighair1988
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a package. We were originally confirmed in a 2 double bed city view room. Our first night there was a sleepless one, as one of the mattresses squeaked loudly everytime the person laying in it moved. Having had an eventful couple of plane rides to San Diego and checking in after 10:30 pm and already in our pajamas by the time we discovered the noise, we were too tired to call down to complain. However, after the long night, I asked the front desk if we could move rooms to try a different bed. Mike at the front desk gave us a different room right away with a smile, I was most impressed. Not only did he give us a different room, he moved us to a Harbor view room. Talk about a view!! The view from our balcony was great. They even gave us the rollaway with no charge. I learned that if you are staying at this hotel, you should definitely spend a little more for the harbor view side of the hotel. There are trains that run at all hours of the night that you can hear rather loudly from the city view side. Also, be warned, parking will set you back over $20 a night. However, I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great service and location-the train noise is not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Location is far from everything...”
Reviews.Author: itzMS
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that this hotel gets its 3-star rating on location alone. Everything else is 2-star. Based on that above statement. everything amenities-wise was below average. I was given a room in the main building with no balcony overlooking the pool area. As I stayed here for work, I could not request a room change. I can see where having the balcony would've been a big plus as the rooms are TINY. They are long and narrow, which puts the bed very close to the door/bathroom and far away from the window. The main building rooms are clearly some of the last to be updated as mine had noticeably dated and scratched fixtures, ancient TV, carpet & furniture. They provided tiny 0.5 oz bottles...barely enough for one use...of shampoo and lotion (Bath & Body Works Coconut Lime) but no hair conditioner. The room service menu was of poor selection and ridiculously priced ($17 for a chicken ceasar salad PLUS delivery charge and 18% gratuity). The bartending staff at the in-hotel Elephant & Castle restaurant was quite rude & inefficient. The in house gift shop is INSANELY overpriced. $2.50 for a snack-sized bag of pretzels, $2 for a 20 oz soda, $7 for a cheaply made "San Diego" magnet...etc. There were no snack vending machines in the hotel either, so bring your own munchies. The ice machine on my floor did not work all week despite telling the staff. Finally, the biggest negative...THE NOISE. Unless you pass out dead away when you sleep, the noise will affect you. Cars, sirens, trains, ship bells & horns, thin room walls, outside chatter of people on their balconies. The ship horns near the dinner hour every day were so loud that I actually had to stop my phone conversation. Also beware if you are not from the area that there are many, many transients ("bums") that ask for spare change. The hotel does keep them off premises, but the second you walk off hotel property, you will get confronted. The positive of my stay was having things to walk to (Starbucks, shopping, restaurants). But there are many other hotels in the area that allow walking distance to Seaport Village, Horton Plaza and the business district. I would not stay again. I had not one second of relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “VERY average”
Reviews.Author: vivace21
Reviews.Content: I did not pick this hotel by my own choice but rather because of a work conference. I usually avoid the Holiday Inn chain, but I had high hopes for this one because tripadvisor users gave it several good reviews. I will admit this hotel had a few good things going for it . Unfortunately it also had several things that made me decide I would most likely never stay there again, and I will continue to avoid the Holiday Inn chain. As many other people mentioned it has a great location and you can walk to everything including the trolly/metro which is great if you want to avoid the pricey cabs. We had an easy walk to seaport village and a nice mall downtown, as well as many different places to eat. I thought they did a good job with the conference as far as stocking the room with food, regulating the temp, etc. I liked the lobby area and they have a great little pub. We had no problems with the shuttle service and the drivers were nice. They came and went as promised and on schedule. The room was located in the south tower and it was clean. The beds were pretty comfortable. The free wireless was great. Other than that it is very very no frills. My biggest complaints are the customer service and the noise. At about 9:00 every night we could hear a lot of banging and dragging of furniture from somewhere near us. It was definately not guest noise...it sounded like renovations or something the hotel was doing. It started promply at 9 every night and ended around 10:30 or 11. It was very loud and annoying, so I called one night. They played dumb and said they had no knowledge of anything going on that would cause such loud noises. Basically they had a very we-don't-care attitude. Also you will hear lots of beeping and honking and car alarms, as well as typical port noises, so just be aware that this hotel is in NOT in a quiet area. I know many of these noises cannot be helped, but slamming furniture around? I asked other people at my conference and they heard it too. Very strange. Another thing that sealed the deal for me and made me decide I would not come back is when I came down to the front desk to ask a quick question. I noticed one of the concierge workers was being very short and rude to the people in front of me. I waited patiently in line, and when it came my turn, they guy stared down at his computer and ignored me for at least 10 minutes. Finally someone else came over to ask if I had been helped. He never once looked up from the computer. Bottom line...if you tolerate noise well and you just need a clean bed to sleep in...and don't much care for nice pools and luxury...this is your place. But if customer service is matters to you, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “promised everything- received nothing”
Reviews.Author: USMCgrad
Reviews.Content: "We reserched a lot of hotels and picked this one for it's shuttle service, which ended up being it's worst feature. The shuttles were late, one-way service only, or did not show up at all. When other hotel stayers complained about the shuttle service, the driver called one of the patrons an "a**hole". We were relying on the shuttles to take us to a Marine Corp. graduation. The first day, it was a drop off only. The hotel would NOT send a shuttle to pick us up at the end of the day, so we had to pay for a cab. The second day, the shuttle dropped us off late, causing us to miss part of graduation day ceremonies. The hotel did a pick up on graduation day, but the driver didn't know what time to show, was late, and would not let everyone on the bus even though it was half empty. Another service they offered was laundry. Well, the washers were broken, so no laundry. Our toilet backed up twice, once prompting a 12:15 AM maintenance call. The shower curtain rod was broken, causing the curtain to constantly slide toward the middle, therefore spilling water out of the front and back of the tub. This made the floor very slippery, so we spent a lot of time mopping. Also, there was a fan in the bathroom, but it did not work at all. Customer service? Forget about it. The did not care at all. Any time we brought up any of these issues, they thought we were trying to get a free upgrade so they did not care. On a positive note, the rooms were clean with fresh towels and beds made every day. Thank goodness for the fresh towels because we needed them for the bathroom floor!

Reviews.Title: “Get a Bay view room”
Reviews.Author: LEOFRICK
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel. Great location overlooking the Bay. We had a bay-view room on the 11th floor and watched the cruise ships come and go. Worth paying he little extra for a bay-view room. Literally a short walk to the cruise terminal over a fairly quiet road with good crossing points.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromTO
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came down to San Diego three days early before our cruise and picked this hotel based on previous reviews from cruisers who came before us. Great choice, with a shuttle bus from the airport and a scheduled shuttle to all the major attractions in the city, we didnâ€™t need to rent a car. The hotel is right across the road from the cruise terminal and near the Maritime museum and USS Midway museum and is only a short walk to lots of restaurants and shops. The only thing that is noticeable is the proximity to the airport and rail line crossing that is nearby. I think if you can get a room in the front part of the hotel overlooking the bay it might not be bothersome. If I go out of the port of San Diego on a future cruise, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if needing a wheelchair accessible room”
Reviews.Author: CraigDownUnder
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks good, is in a great position, and the pub/restaurant is busy. However, having requested an accessible room for my companion, we were sent to the farthest end of the South tower. This in itself is strange, as wheelchair accessible rooms are usually the ones close to the central amenities as possible, for obvious reasons. What a disappointment. The standard rooms have king beds, while the wheelchair accessible rooms are only doubles. (.... You remember -- the small beds they had in the 50's before everyone got queens and kings.) Many of the standard rooms have balconies and views, but the whole of the ground floor (i.e. no views at all) of the South tower is accessible rooms. Also, ice machines are on every floor except ground, so you have to go to another floor to get ice. The room layout is poor, there's no desk, the bathroom door opens the wrong way (i.e. towards the rest of the room, so that opening it blocks getting to the bathroom!), there are wires falling out of the wall near the bed. At least the free wifi works fine.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn On the Bay well worth the money for Philly fan”
Reviews.Author: jgdo16
Reviews.Content: i traveled with a group of ten guys (mid 20s) and we all enjoyed the HI on the Bay immensely. If you are going to stay downtown i would def recomend this hotel. I had a bay view room; the other rooms my friends were in faced the city skyline.... GET THE BAY VIEW ROOM IF U CAN!!! Either way, you cant go wrong for the price. The hotel was very clean and the staff was great. Close to Gaslamp and everything else. The restaurant downstairs was really good and the deli right outside was great for a cheap meal or breakfast. Bicycle / Scooter rental place outside was a plus for us. Tip..... If you plan on going anywhere else besides downton (Pacific Beach, Ocean Beach, Olde Town, Coronado etc... you need to rent a car. The hotel charges $22 a night to park in the lot but so does every other hotel down there, you can't get around it. Dollar for Dollar, HI on the Bay was WELL worth it. p.s. if your looking for nightlife... wed night at SideBar is sick, also check out Altitude (pricey but swanky) and Hard Rock is good time although we couldnt get to the roof top bar since you needed a "wrist band" which they were only giving to Hard Rock guests. WhiskyGirl and Henrys (next door to eachother) and for the Micro Brew people... RockBottom had some tasty brews.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you choose carefully”
Reviews.Author: hennypenny10
Reviews.Content: If you like privacy then try to stay in the tower that is not attached to the reception area. The newer section of the hotel has renovated bathrooms with opaque glass doors on the bathrooms that let you see the silhouette of the person inside. The bathroom doors face the beds, have no locks, and simply slide closed leaving gaps at the top and bottom and allowing whoever is in the room to hear (and basically see) what you are doing in there. If you are not modest then go for it, otherwise, stay in the other tower. The tower that has not been renovated yet has normal bathroom doors that allow for the privacy that most people need. Other than that the hotel is great. The restaurants were good and the staff was helpful. The hotel is right on the bay but the views in all directions are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic go for the Bay!”
Reviews.Author: jbwjb
Reviews.Content: Did my research on this site. got a great rate thru hotel website & Priority Club rewards. Holiday Inn channels you thru to this if you are a member. they offered discounts from numerous programs, AAA, AARP, entertainment book, and we did not have to pre-pay. the hotel took incredible care of us from check in to check out. barely a flaw. we took advantage of their free shuttle, form the airport to center of town and to the zoo. got discount 2-day zoo passes thru Costco.com. hotel location was better than expected. we weren't sure how far the walk would be other than the events across the street. it was not bad at all for those who enjoy a good hike. walked a short distance to little italy, a bit farther to town, but very doable! ate at the attached elephant & castle, 1st time used coupon from restaurant.com, but loved it, went back 3 times for food and cocktails. found many other restaurant.com locations, but our time was limited, and there were so many places to pick from on every street, we just enjoyed unplanned experiences..... also ate at ruth chris, they have a full course meal option for $39 &/or $49 that was a great buy. snack shop just downstairs and found a rite aid about 2 blocks from Hol Inn, very handy. I must say, opt for the extra and get a BAY view! unreal! cruise ships in and out daily. tons of entertainment. we had the 12th floor and would love to return to our same room. the second nite there were fog horns going off and we thought it could be routine, but no. just loved the horns blowing for the ships final boarding call. this is not a location for a dull quiet getaway. weather was gorgeous. we also took the 2 hr bay cruise and loved it. for the best program at goldstar, 1st experience w/ them, and it was fine. hotel and room, simple and fine. always clean, rooms cleaned well and timely. entire staff, from check in to out did a great job! can't say enough about the value. even free internet, worked great. loved the gift shop, stocked up on tee shirts. go, hope you have as nice a stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms almost worth the price”
Reviews.Author: PSUGrad17
Reviews.Content: You can't argue with the location. The staff was very friendly and the service was very good. We needed more towels and they were there within minutes. The room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel. It seems like they are updating the rooms in such a was as to compete with the other "modern" hotels. The decor was very nice but the bothroom had no tub (didn't bother us but may have been a problem for someone else). The bothroom door was translucent and thus when you are trying to sleep, the light from the bathroom was very bright in the room. The door also did not have a lock on it (pocket door). The TV was about a 19" that was not a flat screen. We did not pay for the ocean view so our view was of the city. I am guessing the ocean view would have been great but that was our decision. We had breakfast there and it was pretty good. Kids eat free so that was nice but the prices for the adults made up for it. That being said, it was still nice not to pay for the kids. Lastly, the price was $139 for a Saturday night. We also had to pay $22 a day for parking. I know we were staying downtown but I think for this economy I could have found a better deal for this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, prime location”
Reviews.Author: wolfhoundb2k
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about staying at a Holiday Inn as I imagine an outdated 80's place. This hotel was modern. The beds and pillows were comfortable and the room stylish. The bathroom was still small and like I imagine Holiday Inn's. All rooms had a balcony. The location was perfect--across from the harbor. Close to the trollies and downtown area that you can walk to. We also returned a rental car and walked here from the airport! Perfect :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jppalooza
Reviews.Content: I stayed on business and had a good view of the harbor, good location very convenient to all including airport

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with good comfort!”
Reviews.Author: MalexCostaRica
Reviews.Content: After looking at hotels back and forth from old town to downtown and the glaslamp quarter we decided to stay here in front of the bay. I have to say that I was thrilled with my choice, it was incredible to see the ships and the harbour from our room. Rooms were clean, had great beds and bathroom seemed to have undergone some updating. We were walking distance from everywhere and the kids loved taking walks along the boardwalk. Parking was a bit expensive but we compensated the expense with the fact that the kids ate free. San Diego Zoo and Sea World were 5-10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cat-aaron
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Diego and chose this hotel for it's location and price. We were very happy with the location when we arrived as is right on the waterfront with wonderful views (although we didn't have an ocean view room which was a little disappointing) The hotel is very spread out so you have to drag your luggage from one end to the other and they don't have anyone to help. Parking was $25 a day (which we weren't prepared to pay) but were staying on a weekend when metered parking is free. (which the hotel neglected to tell us as they wanted us to pay the $25) There's a fantastic "English" pub in the hotel which serves "traditional" English food, is worth going there for a pint and a meal!

Reviews.Title: “Hot water was too much to ask for.”
Reviews.Author: Ray077
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a concert so we decided to stay here since it was close to the venue. BIG mistake! Upon arrival we wanted to clean up first but we had no hot water. I called the front desk and they said they would send someone up. A hour passed and we couldn't wait anymore. On the way out we informed the front desk again that nobody came to fix it. They said they would take care of it. We returned from our concert after 10pm and headed straight for the shower. It was luke warm at best. We will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views from the room - but appointments tired and in need of a make-over”
Reviews.Author: minack_7
Reviews.Content: We had two nights here in San Diego at this hotel. We upgraded to an ocean-view room for a small amount and enjoyed a fabulous view. The only down side was that the view was ruined by the sun belting into the windows in the afternoon and heating the room up quite considerably. If you opened the sliding doors the noise level was very high - mostly trains, planes lined up for takeoff at the airport and other guests slamming their doors. The ice machine in the corridor on our floor was not working and there was no fridge in the room. A small fridge would be a huge improvement as would a safe. The hotel would probably benefit from a make -over to the rooms in the south tower.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel on San Diego Bay”
Reviews.Author: Murrantravels
Reviews.Content: My family (husband and 6 year old daughter) stayed here in August. Beautiful room overlooking San Diego bay. Room is a nice size with two double beds, which were very comfortable. Bathroom is spartan but very clean. Hotel is upscale for Holiday Inn with a nice lobby and a helpful concierge. Free shuttle service from airport and to and from the San Diego Zoo and Padres game helped us saved money!! Nice restaurant (English pub) on site. Nice pool but it's in shade a lot of the day. All in all a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for a price”
Reviews.Author: alkuzn
Reviews.Content: I booked it using priceline. Very decent place. If you are not a snob and like simple treatment and casual atmosphere - this place is for you. I like both things but really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. The room are clean and renovated bathroom is a plus. I did not get the sea view - but did not pay for it. Very good location. Overall - nice stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TraLonW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night so wanted something relatively close to airport due to check in at 5.00 a.m. Room was a good size, with two double beds. Not sure about the sliding, frosted glass bathroom door though!. Everything was clean and the staff helpful. As we had a room at the back of the hotel - i.e. facing the city rather than the water the trains were quite noisy and they ran throughout the night so if you want peace and quiet I would suggest asking for a water view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & the price is the best - will stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Punkinhead61406
Reviews.Content: We tried out Priceline this time for our weekend in San Diego and Holiday Inn on the Bay was the most appealing hotel option so despite some negative reviews I read on Trip Advisor we figured we'd try it out because the price was so great. We loved it! The hotel is in the best location right across from the cruise ship terminal and you can walk up and down the boardwalk, to Little Italy, SeaPort Village, Horton Plaza mall, Gaslamp (where the bars and clubs are) and the hotel itself is very nice. It may not be a 4 star but it was clean, comfortable and the staff was very friendly. I will note that others reviewed the opaque bathroom sliding door and yes they are that way and very not "private" but we thought it was funny. There's a small balcony at least if you need some "fresh air" ;-) The Elephant & Castle Pub has amazing food and awesome bloody mary's ;-) They are a bit pricey but we never did try the cafe a few doors down because we liked the food at the pub so much. It was reasonable I think for a typical meal in San Diego anyway! The hotel shuttle is right at the airport waiting for you and is only about 5-10 minutes away if not. They shuttle you to the San Diego zoo, Horton Plaza, SeaPort Village, etc. They even shuttled us to SeaWorld one day for less than a cab would have charged so that was very convenient. Like I said most stuff is w/in walking distance anyway. San Diego in general is great we go frequently and always have fun. I recommend staying in downtown just because it's so convenient. **TIP: One downfall of the Holiday Inn is they charge $22 a night per parking which is insane. But we had a rental car and never paid the parking fee because even in July there was always a meter available right out front which was free from I think midnight to 8am so factor in simply the cost for the meter after 8am and we got a good deal. Save your money and either park at a meter or go to the 5 star lot right around the block. We didn't use the pool or the gym (didn't need to with all the walking) but they looked really nice and clean. Some reviewers mentioned noise from the trains. It is (a ways) behind the hotel but never bothered us at all. We stayed in the front hotel so maybe that makes a difference. The only noise that bothered me was the horn from the cruise ships but that's only because it seemed to always go off right as I walked by and scare the he!! out of me! SeaPort was awesome. The gardens down there are perfect for a wedding and there are even horse-drawn carriage rides through the park. There are lots of waterfront restaurants, good wines and food, and about 50 some specialty shops with lots of neat things. I heard a lot of great music and even bought cds from a guy playing the pan flute - so beautiful! It's a cool place to walk around for a few hours anyway. Look for the beer stand that sells 32 oz. for $4... definitely a bargain ;-)

Reviews.Title: “use mass transit to sea world, zoo, petco park, etc.”
Reviews.Author: correctinfoUsa
Reviews.Content: A previous poster said you have to drive to get anywhere from this hotel. That is not true. The Metropolitan Transit System can be accessed two blocks away. Just walk to the East (away from the bay) across Pacific Highway, then continue one more block. Directly behind the Hampton Inn is the stop where you can buy tickets and board. Take the BLUE line trolley to Old Town (this is not the same thing as the Old Town Trolley Tour!!), then board bus #9 to go to Sea World (about 20 minutes total trip unless rush hour traffic). To the zoo, board the BLUE LINE destination Tijauna, but get off at City College stop, take the #7 bus (a 20-minute trip total). I did not stay at this hotel, just wanted to correct the misinformation given by the person who said you have to drive. We just returned from a weeklong trip and took this Metro system almost everywhere..the ballpark, Sea World, Zoo, Petco for a ballgame, Horton's Plaza shopping center... Don't let transportation keep you from staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: smileyliam
Reviews.Content: An excellent location, close to downtown with sea-view rooms available. My room was excellent, clean and fairly modern bathroom. I booked a sea-view room with balcony - I would highly recommend absolutely no complaints although I only had one `free` day during the trip (spent touring the USS Midway - 3 minutes walk) Starbucks and A+F in walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Great Selection!”
Reviews.Author: daltexgal
Reviews.Content: Needing a fun, affordable room in San Diego for my first visit I started searching on line from my living room in Texas I decided I needed to be downtown SD! I found this hotel to be well within my price range. I'm a 50 something, meeting up with my 20 something son from LA. I froze the picture of the balcony pic on their website and used it as my screen saver for 2-months. I did not want to be disappointed.. I wasn't expecting the Ritz but I wanted a great experience, with an amazing view of the bay. This hotel delivered. Yes, it is older and the bathrooms may be small, but our 2 queen bed room was great. The beds were comfy and despite what I thought would be a hiccup at check in... I had requested a tall floor with a harbor view..At $40/more night, it just wasn't in the old budg... A manager came over and offered that a down town view of SD would be equally breathtaking; he sensed my desire for the harbor view and gave us a corner balcony on the 10th floor with no upcharge! Sorry we didn't get your name, but THANK YOU!!! It was perfect. Best of the harbor view and downtown! We were there for 2 nights and we will never forget it. We loved our balcony-time! The location was amazing -- just like the reviewers say-- easy access to everything. Take the ferry (catch it across the street) and enjoy a short scenic ride to Coranado Island-- go on Tuesday evenings and enjoy the $10 tastings -- Wines from all over the world with a knowledgeble tender and see why it is such an historic event to see the Del! The on-site tavern was great. The bartenders were fun and great prices. Anthony's Fish Grotto (a SD must!) across the street and any of the multitude of things and places to see and do in one of the most beautiful cities in the world! I'll return in a heartbeat! I left my heart in San Diego! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great VIews”
Reviews.Author: jenpro
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Hotwire. When we arrived we were given a room on the bayside with one full sized bed (for a family of 3)! However, we were told that the hotel was pretty much emptying out in the morning and that we could change rooms. We were told we would have room 655 and that it too had a bay view. We had purchased a room for 7 nights. Then next morning, I went to inquire about the room and was told that it was not ready. I wanted to verify the room number but when I asked the woman told me that she could not tell me which room number it is until we check in. She then made reference to the fact that we had purchased on Hotwire.. Not sure what that meant at the time. We went to check in again later, at this time it was after 3:00PM and was told that our room still wasn't ready. So, we left and came back again at 6:00. This time we were told that room 655 had been sold to someone else who was not a Hotwire guest. She said Hotwire guests do not get a bay view room. We were then given a room on the 8th floor in the south tower facing some factories and high rises. Such a disappointment! My husband call the bell boys to help move our stuff from one tower to another but was told they were too busy. We stayed in this room for two nights, but could no longer stand the smell of the cigarette smoke coming through the vents from our loud and obnoxious neighbors on both sides of us. It is really like they surrogate middle class and lower class people. The lower class being people who book on Hotwire. I finally went and asked for a manager. I told her about her staff's constant reminder that we were Hotwire guests and that we couldn't take the cigarette smell anymore. She was very nice and apologetic and immediately moved us to a bayview room. Its amazing the class of people they put on this side of the hotel compared to the other. I think it is worth it to ask to be upgraded to a bayview room. One night, my husband called to order a piece of chocolate cake from room service. The clerk said, "What else can I get you?" To which my husband said that was it. She laughed sarcastically and said, "That's it? Well it'll be an hour then. Our you sure you want it?" My husband then said, "No forget it!" On the plus side the room was clean. The housekeeping staff is really great! Very nice! If you have a problem with anything go to the manager. Do not waste time with the hotel clerks!

Reviews.Title: “WHY STAY ANYWHERE ELSE? IT'S ALL HERE !”
Reviews.Author: christographer
Reviews.Content: You would be insane to stay anywhere else, the Holiday Inn San Diego at on The Bay is the best gem that San Diego has to offer. I've spent many years traveling and staying at Marriotts, Hiltons and Hyatt's, but have NEVER seen a cleaner more sincere hotel than THIS Holiday Inn on the Bay ! Don't be fooled by the Holiday Inn that is nearby (Holiday Inn Downtown) it may look cool, but the Holiday Inn on The Bay, is the one you want. 2 Large towers and one Small tower with rooms that put you almost directly over the water. Out your door and through the lobby and >WHAM< you are in the heart of it ! Steps away from anything you want to do in this area! period! You could pay more....and you could payless.....but your money and time are best spent here !!! We loved it ....as did our kids ages: 15, 12 and 8.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel Welcome...Didn't feel safe exactly”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: Hey Everyone... I had a fluke booking through Priceline and decided to go with Hotwire...$60 plus taxes and it did include free Internet as most ICH properties do...I arrived in SD at 10pm and drive in late to avoid early driving from LA issues... Well at 10pm, I didn't expect to have 5 people in front of me...the desk clerk was by himself and there was a shuttle driver lurking around in the Conceirge area...After about 15 minutes of waiting or so they got to me...I just didn't feel welcome, it is just as easy to say as that. I usually don't feel treated like a "Hotwire/Priceline" person but this time around I got that vibe... Now this property is right on the bay which is nice if you have a room with a view I imagine...lol my view was the window near the elevators :) The hotel is across from a horrible tourist trap restaurant you should avoid ( I learned a couple years back) and next to the big English ship. They have a decent little pub in the hotel...That said the proprty is pretty big as they have three towers. Parking is $22 a day and lugging my luggage at 11pm far away wasn't super fun but you know...I try to make lemons out of lemonade...I would look for a new place the next day.. The room: They try for little touches like 2 firm and 2 soft pillows but those details are lost on a room thaty needs updating. I felt very priceline in that I could put over another building in a room that looked like it was part of a multi-room suite ( doors on both sides?) The bathroom on the other had is remodeled BUT it only has a SHOWER...which sorta sucks if you are a hairy girl who needs to save (not to management other hotels with only showers I have been too have little wood benches which make shaving/relaxing EASY)....The chair in the room is probably older then me!!! The room was a bit smoky but I didn't understand why until I realized that this 1960's hotel has balconies which I thought would be nice..Once again if I had had a view it would of been nicer..Each balcony has two chairs and it was fun to check out the nearby new lofts. If you are a exhibitionist or voyeur...you will enjoy, I was actually pleased for a second UNTIL I saw the sign that you should close your window for "safety reasons'....and I realized that all the balconies were attached (ie if you are a crazy robber/rapist you could walk ONTO my balcony and INTO ROOM if I kept my window door open..This sorta ruined my plan to sleep with the window open and let the sea air wake me up...as I had a vision of possible previous crimes... Would i go back...umm I think I would pass for another option. IMPORTANT NOTE: I sleep like a log but for lite sleeps this hotel is next to a tram/rail station. At 3am there were red lights and lonts of dinging...didn't phase me but should be noted.. For kids the balcony would be a huge safety issue...

Reviews.Title: “So- so.....high 2 star, low 3 if at all.”
Reviews.Author: bartondarr
Reviews.Content: What can one expect from an older Holiday Inn, but an older one and it shows. Kinda reminds me of an older Las Vegas style hotel. Parking is way overpriced at $22 per day, and if you want a mini fridge its an extra $10 a day. Laundry facilities available, but only 1 washer and dryer per tower, so be forewarned of the wait time maybe to use it. But you do at least have free WiFi in the room. We got an Ocean View King room, so by mid afternoon room temp was hot, needed the drapes closed all the way, with AC on otherwise it was stifling hot by supper time. And the road noise is terrible, since the cruise ship dock is right across the street pretty much. Also, lots of regular road traffic including heavy trucks. You want quiet, best to take the cityscape view instead. Room is okay, bed was squeaky springs on one side, but somewhat comfortable. If you want a basic hotel its fine, but if you want a more luxury, go elsewhere. Location is great though, walking distance to lots of attractions, shopping, waterfront, restaurants, etc. One can even take a ride on a bike cart taxi service, cute at first but they become a real pain after a while approaching you for business. They use a right in your face approach, and after 50 times being asked it got very annoying. Room service expensive, add on an 18% service fee, plus delivery charge. Make sure you go see the USS Midway floating museum, the Maritime Museum, and take the 2 hour tour around the harbor, well worth the money! The Aerospace museum NE a few miles is a great value, but only if planes interest you. But there is also a car museum right beside it.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, do not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: gkteach
Reviews.Content: The room we were put in was located in the south tower, which is quite a walk from the hotel lobby. This was inconvenient when upon checking into our room we found a bug on the bed. The front desk did not pick up the phone so we were forced to walk all the way down there to rectify the situatuon. Instead of offering some kind of upgrade for the inconvenenience, they put us into a room next door to our first one that smelled as if a dead fish had been left in it. After going down for a second time, they finally put us into an adequate room. The customer service was still poor, and this was only the first day!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but could use more updating”
Reviews.Author: craftylady00
Reviews.Content: My husband was in SD for a convention so I tagged along with our 7 yr old. Our favorite part about the hotel was the location. It was right across the street from the bay, boat cruises, and tours. There was also a great seafood restaurant called Anthony's. We ate there twice. Yum! If you want finer dining Ruth Chris's Steak house is a couple doors down as well. Food there was great! As other reviewers have said, the Gas lamp district is in walking distance. We walked there with our 7 yr old who did not complain. We also checked out Horton Plaza Mall. We also spent a nice afternoon at the zoo which was pretty easy to find. The hotel room was on the small side. Hubby also requested a bay view but found out once we were there that they put the convention people in the back rooms of the hotel! Hope they gave the company a good rate! Now I pay attention to reviews and knew what to expect. It was noisy ! The train passed at night and let us know! I slept with ear plugs. My husband and daughter did not seem to be bothered once they were asleep. There is also a lot of construction going on. Our daughter was fascinated with the elevators going up and down on the construction site. To make up for us not having the bay view a nice guy at the front desk gave us a roll away bed for our daughter and a fridge. I was surprised they did not even have a microwave in the room. I thought that was the norm nowadays. We brought popcorn and could not pop it. The bathroom was newly remodeled but we found that the sliding door would not close all the way. If you are traveling & sharing rooms with a co-worker that could be tricky. King bed was very comfortable. We ate breakfast at the restaurant downstairs but found it very pricey. $6.50 for a bowl of Quaker oatmeal??? Anywho, we found the deli a couple doors down more reasonable and breakfast was good. Overall our stay at the hotel was good. The hotel staff were very nice and I think that made up for any short comings the hotel might have. I think they should do some more remodeling because they are at a great spot. I would stay again but only if I got a bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Horribly and Checked Out in the Middle of the Night”
Reviews.Author: kaflansburg
Reviews.Content: I arrived to find out that parking would be $22 a day. I was not happy from the start. I tried to check in. Over an hour later, after getting my reservation sorted out with two front desk clerks and a manager who refused to emerge from his cozy office (the desk clerk kept going back to the manager every two minutes because he had no authority), I got into my room. It was so hot I could barely breathe. Spent 20 minutes in the room changing my clothes, went out to dinner with my friends, and came back to my room a few hours later. The air was so thick and humid in the room I could not even breathe. I packed my bag, checked out before midnight, was refused a refund of the Holiday Inn Reward Points I used to book the room, paid my huge parking fee, and drove the 3 hours home rather than stay overnight there. Stay anywhere but this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not much else”
Reviews.Author: iagainsti
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's get the good out of the way right off the bat: this hotel is in just about the best location there is. If you are taking a cruise out of San Diego, you'll be able to basically walk out of your hotel room and on to the ship. I think this is where this hotel gets a lot of its business. Moreover, the hotel is within walking distance to some great things to do. The Midway aircraft carrier, Seaport Village, the old sailing ships, not too far from the Gaslamp Quarter. And, you're only a few miles from Old Town. Now for the bad. I'm no snob, but this hotel needs some serious updating. We rec'd a room on the second floor, right next to the elevator and ice machine. Needless to say, some in our family didn't get a very good night's sleep. There was a bunch of young kids across the hall partying it up into the wee hours, yelling and carrying on. Did the hotel staff just not care? The two beds in our room were small. I thought it would be two queens but it was more like two fulls or doubles. The room itself was very small. I also have little doubt that we rec'd such a poor location due to the fact that we booked on priceline. I've heard that this is common. Finally, be prepared to pay $22 to park your car. That's right! $22!! Amazing. This is somewhat common in this part of San Diego as you're basically in the city. But, given that I only paid $64 for the room, what can you expect? Next time, I'll just spend a few more bucks and go the the Marriott or the Hilton. In this case, I booked at the last minute and took what I could get.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Will Stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: alohawahineMaui
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the proximity to the Port of San Diego as I was headed out on a cruise. I stayed one day before the cruise and one after. I had a red eye flight and arrived in SD at 8am and the front desk agent was kind enough to have a room prepared and I was in a room napping by 9am. I was very thankful! The room was modern, good sized. I enjoyed the lanai/deck with my beautiful city view. Room service was efficient and friendly. The restaurant downstairs is good for appetizers and a cold beer and some laughs for sure! There is free wireless internet. There is also a complimentary computer to print boarding passes. The concierge looked busy and "in the know". There is not only an airport shuttle running but also shuttles to local attractions which makes things so easy! I will stay here again for sure. I did have a city view which is a bit loud but nothing obnoxious. Very friendly staff! I have stayed at a couple hotels in hotel circle in SD but this far exceeds them all. I think theres something about being right down on the water and a short walk from Seaport Village. It was GREAT. I'll definitely be back! **Going on a Cruise?? This hotel is literally right across the street. So easy!***** I attached a photo of the hotel from the cruise ship. Holiday Inn has 2 towers in the center of the pic PS: the deli next door is EXCELLENT!!! The only things I want to comment on so you are not suprised is: 1.) the pool is surrounded by buildings with windows so now ultimate in privacy. It is also a smaller pool but nice sized sun deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great View & Location but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: This Holida Inn is in a great location right in downtown San Diego right on the bay. It is right across the street from the San Diego Cruise Terminal so cruise ships are coming and going daily. Get a room with a bay view on a high floor and you won't be disappointed. All rooms have balcanies so you can sit outside and watch the boats in the bay as well as seeing the planes coming and going from the airport. The rooms are very nice and completely updated. Everything was comfy and clean. The only thing that was kind of weird was that the bathroom had a frosted glass sliding door which doesn't give much privacy. My only concern was that you could hear noises from other rooms as well as the balcanies from other people talking and partying on their balcanies. Since this is an older hotel, the noise insulation is very poor. But, all in all, this was a great location and easy to get around without the feeling of a busy crammed in downtown hotel. Lots of parking but about $22 per day. Good British Pub style restaurant in the hotel with a Ruth's Chris Steakhouse right on the property also. I would definately stay here again. But again, make sure you get a bay view room on a high floor and you will just love the view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trixie33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre and post a Mexican riviera cruise. It was great as it is right across the street from the cruise dock. However as we are elderly and had a lot of luggage we asked for a shuttle ride to the ship and were accommodated. We had a bay front room and it was great looking across the harbor and we could see the airplanes coming and going from the airport. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Someone mentioned the trains. They are nearby, however they did not wake us up during the night. Maybe we are heavy sleepers. We did hear them early in the morning. We did hear a couple of dogs but they didn't wake us either... i mention this if you are adverse to pets in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Got the OPPOSITE of What We Asked For”
Reviews.Author: BarclayNewEngland
Reviews.Content: What a difference it makes when hotel staff listen. Both prior to our trip and at the desk we requested a very quiet room, and instead got: a room directly over the entrance, above a noisy bunch of large military trucks, DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM A CONSTRUCTION SITE, and on busy Pacific Highway. Construction noise began at 7AM. Spent the four nights wishing for a room over the pool which would have been much quieter. Quite possibly will never stay at a Holiday Inn again due to the complete indifference of staff members. Advice: if you make a request prior to your stay, get a promise in writing. These staff members just don't try. Television set, very old and cheap, several channels did not work, plus one of three lamps did not work. The TV cable system is very limited and the decor is 1950's blonde with very old, not very clean carpets (due to age.) Weather unseasonably cold and damp and we had to request extra blankets, which were threadbare cotton. Loads of conventioneers. Our business associate got an even worse room across from the bar. He described this hotel as "the pit." We were all delighted to leave, never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you cruise from San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sprayny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in January for one night only, before my cruise. The cruise terminal is literally across the street. No need to take any shuttle or taxi getting to the dock. Just cross the street! And if you want a wonderful surprise in the morning... ask for a room facing the bay. When you wake up you'll find the bow of the ship waiting for you. It was wonderful! I've really enjoyed my stay here. From the airport I took their free shuttle, but since the airport is very close, even a taxi would have been unexpensive. 10 minutes ride and I was in the lobby. Got there early but the room was ready. Now, my room was nice, clean and spotless. Nothing to complain about, I had as well a little balcony. Maybe is not the same as a 5 stars hotel, but it was a good one and I would certainly go back. They have a computer available by the concierge that you can use for free to check emails or flight, for about 5 minutes. Otherwise there is a regular computer where you pay. Walking to the heart of downtown takes about 10-15 minutes. I went out that night and enjoyed San Diego nightlife. In the morning I had a walk by the oceanfront, watched people getting off by the ship, then checked out and headed to the cruise terminal. Didn't use any hotel restaurant or other service. The pool looked nice too. Overall I had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: msladyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very clean hotel for one night before our Mexican cruise. Hotel is much nicer on the inside then the out. Location is right across the street from the cruise port with beautiful bay views and nicely updated rooms. It was exciting to see our ship in port, but beware that it is also a noisy area as the hotel is also situated near the train station. You could hear ships and trains blowing their horns in the early hours of the morning. It didn't bother us that much, but if you are a light sleeper, you could easily get annoyed.
